label: 検非違使
本: From Sovereign to Symbol: An Age of Ritual Determinism in Fourteenth Century Japan . Oxford University Press . 2012
説明文: The capital, or imperial police, an office dating from the ninth century, whose members were responsible for guarding the capital and adjudicating disputes from the 1230s onward. Success as chief of the police (betto) constituted a springboard for success at the court.
